Title: LLMs are cheap
Description: A lot of people think LLMs are expensive to operate. That was true a couple of years ago, but these people haven't updated their views after an approximately 1000x reduction in prices over two years.

Title: Bruteforcing the phone number of any Google user
Description: From rate limits to no limits: How IPv6's massive address space and a crafty botguard bypass left every Google user's phone number vulnerable

Title: Rust is Officially in the Linux Kernel
Description: Today’s Issue: Designing Error Types in Rust Libraries, 10 Years of Betting on Rust, and C++ to Rust Phrasebook

Title: Devlog ⚡ Zig Programming Language
Description: This page contains a curated list of recent changes to main branch Zig.

Title: FSE Meets the FBI! — FSE Blog
Description: I have for you a bizarre tale of scrapers, feds, data poisoning, Torswats, and everyone's favorite fedi instance.  It veers technical, because I suspect it will be of interest to other people running servers with UGC (i.e., every fedi instance), and also because the mechanics of how I figured out what I figured out might be useful.  It's also got information about how the FBI collects data, which is of interest to everyone, but especially US citizens.  I have a few pieces of the puzzle, maybe someone with interlocking pieces can say more; I'm happy to compare notes.

Title: Kagi Search Stats
Description: Better search results with no ads. Welcome to Kagi (pronounced kah-gee), a paid search engine that gives power back to the user.

Title: Building supercomputers for autocrats probably isn’t good for democracy, actually
